trial_identification.studytitle: A pilot study to investigate the efficacy of dexamphetamine to treat obesity using dosage titration
trial_identification.scientifictitle: A pilot study to investigate the efficacy of dexamphetamine to treat obesity using dosage titration

interventions.interventions: 6 months treatment with dexamphetamine 5mg oral tablets given twice daily. The dose is increased by weekly increments of 10mg to a maximum of 12 tablets per day (60mg), stopping short of the maximum dose if there are side effects.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Weight loss from baseline (difference between weight in kg at baseline and weight in kg at 3, 6 and 12 months)

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Maintenance of weight loss, as determined by change in weight (kg) over the 6 months following cessation of treatment

eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Unstable heart disease Uncontrolled hypertension History of addiction to illicit drugs uncontrolled epilepsy weight change of +/- 3kg the past 3 months breastfeeding, pregnant or planning pregnancy current depression or other psychiatric illness current or recent treatment (past 12 months) with psychotropic medication, systemic glucocorticoids or medication for weight loss (eg orlistat) family history of sudden death from cardiac causes

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The project is designed to test a) whether dexamphetamine can be used safely to treat adults with obesity, b) whether dexamphetamine is effective for treating obesity over a six month period
